Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 4.1
  • PCI DSS Requirement 4.1.c

What to Do

Use SSL/TLS for web pages that handle cardholder data. Design the site in such a way that https:// is always visible in the URL of those pages.

Why

HTTPS in the URL tells the user that the session is encrypted with SSL/TLS. If frames are used in a web application, then the URL may not accurately reflect whether SSL is used.

How

Use SSL/TLS to encrypt cardholder data sent to the web application. Install the SSL/TLS implementation that applies to the web server that you are using. Configure the web server so that SSL/TLS is used for accessing the web application. If SSL/TLS is not used for all parts of the web application, configure the server so that the parts of the web application that require cardholder data use SSL/TLS. If frames are used in the web application, place the page with the frame-set in a location that is accessible only through HTTPS.
